name: Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas
description: Five years ago Carl Johnson escaped from the pressures of life in Los Santos, San Andreas... a city tearing itself apart with gang trouble, drugs and corruption. Where filmstars and millionaires do their best to avoid the dealers and gangbangers. Now, it's the early 90s. Carl's got to go home.

My god! It's been almost 10 years since this game was released! That was quite a long time ago. And to see it released after Vice City it was a big deal. Seriously, the game employed at least 10 times the area Vice City had. And here there are 3 different cities available not to mention the countryside in between these. This game is huge and just by completing all side missions you can easily go over a 100 hours of gameplay time!  This game still did not have any physics as in order to get the next gen feeling we needed to wait for the 4th instalment of the franchise. But this is not a problem as in case you look at it as Vice City's successor you can appreciate what San Andreas offers: greater playable area, hundreds of vehicles, minigames, car modifications, gang wars and the ability to purchase clothing, tattoos and even to have your own haircut.  I had only an issue with the game's RPG elements: for some reason some stunts are not available at first and you need to keep driving a car until you unlock the next level. To be able to sprint further or have stronger punches in melee you need to visit the gym often. From time to time you need to eat but junk food will soon make you obese. So you need to visit the gym again. These side activities stole some of my time and I never liked paying any attention to them but I had to. I liked how these were skipped in the next episode which, unfortunately, skipped the car modifications and this is the only GTA with bikes in it! And to date, in my opinion, this game has used the best voice actors in the series: Samuel L. Jackson, Chris Penn, Ice T and James Woods just to name a few.   This is a classic and if you like the 'old' GTA games but for some reason skipped this one now is to time to purchase it. Or when it's discounted as 10 bucks is a bit too much for such a title but I'm sure the price will soon drop.
This is a masterpiece. If you love GTA get this immediately.

The first law of gaming is that a video game must first and foremost have fun and this Grand Theft Auto San Andreas does ... and does it very well. The title is improved a lot compared to the previous episode, while presenting a linear plot, without much intrigue and twists; many sub-main missions (those wonderful stealth to recover some powerful weapons, or the music game-positioned to play in your car stereo stolen with a ball), so the various locations and different approaches to situations (you can, for to impress even get tattooed images on the body), make this unique title, despite being in effect a PC-game. The more than one hundred missions lead to use of the product for an average of about sixty hours of play, a time worthy of the best Final Fantasy. Our part venal takes over but we must admit that the sixty euro for GTA San Andreas are worth all, a title that will please those who waited for months now, who drooled over pictures and those who grew up in the 90s; after all graphics, sound and gameplay mixed for good are the true essence of the game is not it?

A great crime game, worth every penny.  Depsite having outdated graphics and an options menu with an anti-aliasing option that you can't activate this game is great fun. I picked it up cheap in the summer sale and I'm glad I did as it's so much fun. I used to think GTA IV was amazing but playing this has made me realise that GTA IV is only a GTA game by a thread. This is the proper crime simulation while GTA IV is more of a casual game this is more realistic (not physics wise but simulation wise).  If you can't run or afford GTA V, I would recommend this. I hear they're very similar, and this will satisfy your GTA needs (hopefully).   Also don't forget to try out the multiplayer mod that was made for this game, it's great fun!  Good game, worth a purchase!  9/10  P.S. Notice my low playtime. In reality I have been playing SAMP (San Andreas Multiplayer) for a LOT more time than what is displayed here. Sadly Steam doesn't track Non-Steam games and executables (Maybe one day...).

GTA San Andreas. I remember when I heard 1st time about it, and thought „what's so cool about being a gangsta ♥♥♥♥♥, stealing cars and shooting at random people?”. Then I pirated it to see for myself, what's that GTA game is. And I swear to my grandma's life, I know San Andreas better than the city I live since my birth (and this will be over 21 years now). Sure, R* totally ruined Steam version with its license-bullsh♥t patches, but GTA modding community is one of strongest and didn't give up and let GTA:SA hurt too much. And this game really worths all the effort you need to put to make it right.

Back when the game first came out for PlayStation 2 I quickly fell in love with it, it felt so revolutionary.. the amount of freedom and the variety of content completely blew my teenage mind. I remember waking up early in the morning booting up my console and spend entire weekends alone and with friends, just messing around, using cheats, and myth hunting on the local multiplayer.  So a few years later when I first bought a computer, I re-purchased this game to reminisce the good old days, that was when I discovered modding for the very first time, I remember spending countless hours a day just fiddling with the game files, so it felt like a completely new experience every time I played.   Ever since then, I've beat the storyline a total of 22 times on both platforms, and I've been playing this game for almost 10 years now... I don't think I will ever experience something like this in my lifetime ever again.  This game will forever be remembered by me as   the pinnacle of the Grand Theft Auto franchise  .

If you're a fan of open world games, or just running over people and stealing their stuff, this is a great game for you. A single playthrough is about 40 hours or so depending on whether or not you like to do much exploring or not (which you should). Personally I feel that the game has aged fairly well, maybe not graphically but then again it is a 10 year old game. It's also probably the most fully featured Grand Theft Auto game (with GTA V coming closer to this then IV did.) with player and vehicle customization being quite diverse and some light RPG elements such as gaining/losing weight, strength, running speed, stealth, and swimming abilities.  Overall if you enjoy the Grand Theft Auto series, games like it, or just feel like you're a black man stuck in a white persons body, then you should very much enjoy visiting San Andreas, whether it's your first time or coming back again.

My Opinion About The Game (Without Story Spoilers) : Grand Theft Auto : San Andreas is an Open World TPS made and published by Rockstar Studios . I probaby don't need to intouduce you to the series. I didn't play Vice City (I will and when I did I'll delete this part of the review) and all the others before that but I played all the others after this one. For me it seems like this one has the biggest world that you can actually go to. Like I said I didn' played the other games before this one (yet) but I think this has the best story out of all of them. I like all of them though. The only con I can think of this game considering it's age are the flying tutorials and missions they are awful hard. You can say that I'm a noob but I've seen a lot of people having the same problem. So I recommend playing atleast that part of the game with a controller but overall I recommend a controller for the game because of the vehicles. There's a small negative part of the game which is small because it doesn't happen if you do this like I say , there's a part of the game where you have to take over territories . And theres a small territory named Jefferson Motel. That territory is so small that enemy gang members doesn't spawn there , so you need to lure them from other territories nearby. But if you took over all the territories except that one you gonna have a hard time capturing it. So I recomend capturing that one first. There are other negatives which I did a researc on when I noticed the same things which are regarding the Steam version not the game itself. Rockstar added a patch to the game which removed songs , option for changing resoultions and something with SAMP isn't right either . I played the crack GTA SA with SAMP and it barely had crashes but with the Steam version it crashes at least 1 time in 1 hour but usually around 2-3 times. And they messed up people's saves but that didn't affect me because I got the game after that. I completed the game's story 100% all the missions all the territories all the stats like Respect , Stamina , Muscle theese kind of things , schools etc. I really like the game's story I like the characters I like that I don't have to go to bowling in every second. If you have Windows 8.1 or Windows 10 and SAMP doesn't start properly run Steam in administrator mode and set both GTA SA and samp exe to run in Windows SP3 (on Windows 8.1) , Windows 98 (on Windows 10) and both in administrator mode. This made the multiplayer worked even tho you still gonna have crashes because of the crappy port.  Graphics : 9 (The game came out in 2005) Audio : 9 (The Steam version itself would be 7 because of the removal of some songs) Gameplay : 10 (If you want to play SAMP on the Steam version you gonna have a hard time and I don't even know about what's up with the modding in it , considering GTA V's status on that) Story : 9  Replayability : 8 (8 because of the hell in the flying missions) Value : 6 (7 If you only buy it for the Single Player )  Overall I recommend the game mainly if you only want to play in single player or if you don't mind a lot of crashes then multiplayer too. Well I wouldn't complain much about it after the GTA IV port. Enjoy the game !

Having been a fan of the series since GTA III, and seeing that each game has its own pros and cons (not excluding this one), I have to admit GTA: San Andreas is still my favorite. The stoyline / voice acting is arguably the best in the series, with no shortage of wacky characters as you'd come to expect from a Rockstar game. Plently of diverse missions and locations to explore (a massive map for its time) with exellent character customization.  I only recently purchased San Andreas on Steam but have sunk countless hours since its intial release on the PS2. It's definitely worth the price tag for this classic, and a no-brainer if you happen upon it on sale.
The thing I love most about this game is that Rockstar couldn't make it today without incurring the wrath of special snowflakes. 11/10.

My actual playtime for this game is off-record, based off of the years I spent on it via disk, when I didn't actually own Steam.  I would say 300+ hours playtime.   San Andreas remains to be my favourite of the series.  - Great story, great music. - Full character customisation - The map is gloriously huge, with 3 different ambient settings - Huge variety with side quests and tasks - Character skill building via gym. RPG element is GO.   K-Rose remains to be my favourite radio station. Everyone else in my house as a child hated K-Rose.  Or at least my singing to K-Rose. Or maybe it was just repeating the whole thing over and over in a badly imitated accent, including the pool table birth part.   One of my favourite things to do, was see how many vehicles I could destroy by parking my car in the middle of the road and shooting the gas tank. You'd be surprised how many people need eye tests. I swear another 10 cars would drive right into that thing without stopping. Best way to make cash, ever.   The 5 star police chases when I flew my plane over area 69, resulting in a hasty parachute down in a complete panic, were intense.   One of the most comfortable games to play ever. If you haven't tried GTA before, I recommend playing this one before GTA V.

I remember 7 year old me walking into a dingy computer room. A washed out sign read above the doorway 'GameZone', if I recall correctly. It was a tight 6x6 space, a dimming light above several desks, there were maybe 6 or 7 computers. Cigarette smoke rising in the air, flattened coke cans on the floor. Smelly teens with a face full of pimples and grease in their hair, children of all ages, gathered all around the fat CRT monitors, playing  Counter Strike 1.6 ,  Diablo II  and then there was  this game ...  Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas .    For 0.50¢ and hour you could have this game all to yourself. And we didn't even do the missions! We just rode around on motorcycles, sped up in cars and had massive shootouts with the police. And the cheats... Oh, all the glorious cheats! Everyone knew them: HESOYAM, OHDUDE, BUFFMEUP, UZUMYMW... A single kid paid the price, but 10 kids played the game together in harmony. Sharing cheats and showing off hacks and tricks.    'Grove Street. Home...'  ♥

One of the best games I have every played! I love the location the characters, (Well, not ALL of them, but I'll get on that later) and the vehicles! I think this was an outstanding achievment for 2004. But, this is not my favorite GTA, that prize goes to Grand Theft Auto Five. I hear you thinking 'It's the same location!' well it's not. It might be in Los Santos, but when I purchased the game this past monday (On the X-Box 360) I took out the map of the game in the box, and (To my displeasure) I did not see San Fierro or Las Venturas on the map. But overall, I like it better that GTA SA for four reasons, 1, More likable characters, I personally did not like CJ all to much in GTA SA, to me, he got annoying, really fast, and I have not played to much of GTA VC, so I can not make a judgement on Tommy. 2, The vehicles, they hadle much more realisticly that SA, and also show more realistic damage that SA. (Where when you get hit in the side all the doors on that side take as much damages so as they look like thay have been hit by a hand grenade) 3, The weapons, that feel more realistic (Well except for the silencers that things some some major BS) and the the add-ons make them weapons near perfection to me. and finally 4, I love the story in GTA SA, but GTA V's story steal the show for me. (Play them both and you will understand). But still for all of it's flaws, GTA SA is one of the best games I have played. If you can, get both this and GTA V, because they are both amazing. I hope this helped you in making a desicion! :D

The best game in the series and make no mistake. It's big and varied in its gameworld, it's fun, it's crazy, it doesn't take itself particularily seriously (fitting the gameplay) and it basically works well from a technical standpoint, being a decent (if still kinda porty) port not plagued and bloated by ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t, DRM-related or otherwise... with every single of these things being in stark contrast to its followup, GTA 4. If you like open world games with tons of fun content, this is one you have to try. Even if you have an older machine, it's no problem. It should work on most computers.

Extremely good game, expands on the established norms in the GTA 3D world and exception story with very likable and believable characters. Lengthy story will keep you hooked and preoccupied for at least 30 hours, and another 20 hours exploring San Andreas and accomplishing side missions and quests. Story is bar none probably one of the best so far in the GTA Series, second to maybe the HD Universe. Old and new characters alike are involved in this journey of one man trying to restablish his ties with his family, but along the way get caught up in a much more bigger plot. The only drawback and downfall of this game is the relatively large empty areas some cities have contained, as the playing field is very large, but has very little to offer in terms of size and it seemingly feels like the areas could have been more condensed with more focus on one area rather than expanding out with little to see. 8.7/10

Oh, San Andreas. Honestly the best GTA ever, with a map and story so large it would take any person a least 30 hours to just run the story. It has loads of mini-games that actually feel integral to the game, not just tacked on for the sake of content. It was the first GTA to have a deep vehicle customization, but none of this 'instantly recall your car after you wreck it' nonsense. Its not without its flaws, but it is so deep rooted in nostolgia that I can only reccomend this game immensely.  Also works well on new systems, runs fine on Windows 7, FX 8350, and a GTX 960.  If you don't have it already, do yourself a favor this winter and replay this PS2 masterpiece, you won't regret it.

Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas is a fun single player game where it is taken place in San Andreas in the 90's. Your character is a young aferican american man named Cj who meets up with his old gang and wants to take back what was once their's! Now in San Andreas you can play missions which is mostly the story to the game, or you can just run around and shoot and steal stuff! You can swim where most of the other GTA's you couldn't. You can also fly airplanes, jets, fighter jets, and not sure but I think helicopters too. Also the this is one of the GTA's where you can pilot a airplanes which is one reason why I bought this game. If you like good story lines or just like to mess around this is so the game for you!

First thing I would like to say, excuse my lack of playtime. I've played it lots back in the day so..  Gameplay: The gameplay is very fun and you can almost always find something to do, you could go to clubs, shoot up the streets, go parachuting, drive around, fly around in a ♥♥♥♥ing JETPACK or do the obvious and spawn in a tank.  Story: The story is beautifully made and there are a lot of missions to go through so you'll always be playing a mission. CJ's character is very well made and his stories with the people around him make it better.  In my experience there has been bugs specifically for PC, sometimes the mouse just doesn't work while in GTA and I can't move the camera at all, which really annoyed me and probably stopped me from playing the game a lot more.  Oh and don't forget all the mods you can download!  9/10 Arguably one of the greatest Grand Theft Auto games made.

Recommended 44.3 hrs on record POSTED: 28 OCTOBER If you're looking for a positive review, then you're in the wrong place, HOWEVER, if you're here for a tremendous chicken Stir Fry recipe, THEN LOOK NO FURTHER!  - Serves 4 - 10 mins to prepare and 10 mins to cook - 325 calories / serving - Healthy  INGREDIENTS:  - 1 orange, zested and juiced - 2tbsp soy sauce - 2tbsp sesame oil - 250g (8oz) tender stem broccoli - 5cm (2in) piece root ginger - 1tbsp sunflower oil - 1 garlic clove, finely sliced - 1 red pepper, deseeded and thinly sliced - 150g Straight To Wok Noodles - 400g (13oz) chicken fillet, cut into thin slices  METHOD  Step 1 - Mix together the orange zest and juice, soy sauce and sesame oil and set aside.  Step 2 - Blanch the broccoli in boiling water for 2 minutes, then drain well and set aside.  Step 3 - Finely shred the ginger. Then heat a large frying pan or wok, add the sunflower oil, heat it until sizzling, and fry the ginger till it's crisp.  Step 4 - When it's done, remove with a slotted spoon. Add the chicken and garlic, and stir-fry until just browned. Remove the meat using a slotted spoon and set aside.  Step 5 - Add the red pepper and broccoli and stir-fry for around 2-3 minutes until it's just tender. Add the soy sauce mixture, bring it to the boil then return the chicken to the pan and heat through. Serve with noodles.But i do love the game ;D

Other than the audio needs a forced compression (click your sound card's 'Loudness Equalization' button), this is a solid game on all fronts, but maybe... too big? Like, starting you out on a bike-no weapons-for a long first mission of getting chased by D-row Ballers with pistols and uzis is a good way of setting the ghettofab, destitute feeling of the early part of the game. However, such an ambitious strain on not only skill, but attention span, so early on in the game, makes it seem needlessly pretentious. Overall the game tends to suffer from that sort of overly ambitious and too sharpley anylized approach, typical of a particular sort of ham-handed game design common to the 'big franchise' games for the PS2 in that era. 3/5 stars

Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas may be one of the most innovated games of its times.  This game is probably the most amazing game out there, it improves so much from Grand Theft Auto: Vice City. This game is time less.   IMPROVEMENTS +The aiming system now has a shoulder view and is much more accurate than before. +Climbing over fences and getting on roof tops is now a thing due to a parkoury feature. Yay! +There are atleast 10 citys, including the small redneck citys in the rural areas. +The game is rather mysterious at times, it leaves you to explore, and occasionally run in to shacks, that have blood on the ground. Creepy... +NATUREEEE!! +So many weapons, so many weapons. +Planes! +Rockstar added the ability to swim! +Amazing story line! +Time less graphics. They age so well! +Everything is just so much more real. +You can change clothes, get your hair styled, and get your body painted. +You can paint and trick out cars. +You can get girlfriends and such. +You can free look while driving, no more pressing buttons, now you use your mouse. +Freelook while running around! +Walk button!  PROBLEMS -Graphical glitchs and stuff, but it does not affect much of anything, -Game often has glitches, like cars teleporting, and what not, but this can easly be fixed, and does not always 100% happen. Pauls GTA Save editor can easily remove SOME glitches. -Not enough Sound Garden  So yeah, it was worth $15 bucks. Grand Theft Auto is worth any price! So get this game and enjoy!

Takes me back to the days when this game felt over realistic.   It's a good game, well made, i must say. A nice storyline with it, great plot twists, missions are challenging but not that difficult. I bought the game just cause ive been playing the crack version as i grew up, and wanted to make a redemption. Downloaded it to re-live the old modding times. The huge throw off was the point of it being unmoddable but it's a great game.  7/10

GTA SA is the best GTA game ever released imo. It has a very good, sort of emotional story line. There's tons of things to do. Rockstar says GTA V has the most massive map ever, but once you play this, you'll notice a lot more, as GTA SA has 3 cities + the country and 4 Airports, while GTA V only has 1 city + the country and 2 Airports. As for the people saying negative about the controls, they're really not that bad once you get used to them and bind them to the correct keys. Also, there are tons of mods out there including multiplayer, but you'll have to downgrade to v1.0 to play it. I don't suggest modding singleplayer until you finish the game or don't care to finish the game, as some mods can screw up the missions like they did for me. I'd give it a 9/10 just because the controls were bunky at first, but I really recommend this game for hardcore GTA fans especially if you played it on the PS2 back in the day. The experience is much better on PC. The render distance mod is probably my favorite, I love seeing all of the cities from the sky.

Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas is the 6th game in the series and one of the best.  The player takes the role of Carl Johnson, an ex-gang member that just heard that his mother was killed and comes back for home for answers. He is almost instantly brought back into his old gang and for the rest of the game he goes on trying to take over his neighborhood and later that whole state.  Players that have played GTA3 or GTA: Vice City know what the game is like; killing, shooting, racing, and just running a muck. And nothing really has changed since the previous games other then a couple little things like the player is able to swim and not die instantly, flying is easier and parachutes are added, lock on isn't perfect but better then before, and the game adds a fat-fitness part where the player has to watch what Carl eats and exercises so that he isn't too fat and slow or too skinny and weak.  One major thing over previous installments is the shear size of the state of San Andreas which it is about 2 to 3 times as big as Vice City's layout and is full of things to do.  The music is a mixed bag for me as most of the soundtrack is full of rap/hip-hop and the only stations I would listen to was the talk and rock stations and sometimes those got boring so I was glad I could mute the game and listen to my iPod.  The voice acting in San Andreas is awesome as all the characters from Carl to Officer Tenpenny all sound like they are real people in this faux world.  Now unless someone was living under a rock for the past couple years, San Andreas came under fire for having a 'hidden' sex game but was only unlockable if the player owns a cheat device or has the PC version and unofficially patched the game so really the game got a little more heat than it should have. And in this edition that part of the code has been removed totally so players wanting to see the 'hot coffee' are out of luck.  Added into the special edition is The Introduction which chronicles the events leading up where the game starts.  In whole the game is a blast to play and if you own a PS2 you shouldn't be caught dead with out it.  10/10

This is when the GTA franchise starts to become what it's most famous for. Again, great voice talent and characters (SAMUEL L. JACKSON, MAN!!!), a vast variety of vehicles, lots of stuff to do, a HUGE environment to explore, and infinitely more customization available than the previous games. I go back and forth on whether I like this one or Vice City more, but based on gameplay and sheer open worldliness San Andreas triumphs in every way. A must have.

The best of the GTA series, and perhaps one of the greatest games I have ever played. There are no words to describe this game. Yes, the graphics are a bit dated, but that's what ENBs were created for. What matters is the gameplay, story, voice-acting, and just the scope of the world. They run the gamut of ecosystems, from cities and towns to farms, mountains, forests, rivers, and deserts. All of the cities feel plausible, and there's a crapton of stuff to do, from shooting pool at the bar and getting a bite to eat at the local pizza joint, to hijacking cars, running from police, gunning down rival gang members, and best of all, MASS GENOCIDE.  There are a few Hollywood celebrities in the game's voice-cast, including Samuel L. Jackson as a crooked cop (who is the main antagonist), Peter Fonda as a hippie, James Woods as a government agent, Wil Wheaton as a news reporter on the radio, and Andy ♥♥♥♥ as a radio talk-show host who is a bit too passionate about gardening.  The game's setting is definitely influenced by Boyz N The Hood, but later goes into the mafia influences of previous and later games. All of the vehicles have their own unique character, and I'm not lying when I say you can drive ANYTHING, from cars, trucks, and buses to trains and boats to planes and helicopters (including the ultimate weapon for any homicidal maniac, a VTOL jet fighter). You can even get around using a stolen jet pack!  The weapons in the game cover a wide variety, from knives, baseball bats, shovels, and katanas, to pistols and shotguns, to machine pistols and assault rifles, and even rocket launchers, flamethrowers, chainsaws, and miniguns. Hint: go to the busiest highway you can find and open fire with the heavy weapons.  If you do not buy this game, you will not be living AT ALL. GTA V may be the newest and have all the bells and whistles, but we would be remiss if we forgot the origins of Los Santos. And besides, neither of my computers can play GTA V. For the lower-end people, GTA: SA is the way to go. Not too graphically-demanding, and packed full of hours of entertainment and story.  Above all else, though, remember to FOLLOW THE DAMN TRAIN.

I've been reading a lot about the 'game-breaking patch' Rockstar released for GTA San Andreas and was afraid to buy the game since I was a big fan from the begining. It was on sale a couple of days ago and I decided to buy it and try for myself this now broken and ugly game, that bloody mobile port everyone was running away from and... THE GAME IS JUST FINE! Sure, some songs were removed which is totally stupid and I really don't understand how can a license for a song in a video game expire during time (why is there a need to renew it) but that's about it. GTA SA looks great, as it always did, plays great and handles very good. My framerate is constant (it wasn't on older versions), no texture poping, draw distance is much better now, the gameplay is the same. All in all I do miss the 14-15 songs that are missing, but with time you stop noticing they aren't there (you can always make your own playlist ingame) but that's about it. Everything else is just perfect. It's GTA San Andreas, the best game ever made in all it's glory. I think that today's kids are just too spoiled and therefore trash everything that doesn't meet their expectations. They thought they were getting an HD version (because all today's kids see is the graphics) and they didn't get that.   I recommend this game to anyone who likes video games. This is the definition of a video game.  10/10  PS: I heard that some are complaining that some resolutions are removed. Well, the support is not removed, just the ingame options, you can make custom resolutions easily by using external software found on the web. Also, if you don't want to risk losing your save files in the future updates just set the update options for GTA SA to update only when you start the game. Now when there's an update for your game you can see it first, before installing it, backup your savegames and than just restore them after the update. Shouldn't be a problem because the savegames are easily found in My Documents and updates are really rare for this game now.  GO BUY THIS GAME!!! NOW!!!

That update has REMOVED 18 songs (including tracks from NWA, 2Pac, Rage Against The Machine, Ozzy Osbourne and Tom Petty) and HD support from a game you owned for years. Yes, you read that right. A patch removed content you PAID FOR when you bought the game. That such a thing is legal and was allowed by Steam, says a lot about the current state of the game industry. It sets a very dangerous precedent.  Not only that, but the patch has also pretty much changed the game into the iOS/Android version - buggy, often crashing, with low resolution - and yet, bugginess is not as bad as REMOVAL OF CONTENT.  While the game is pretty much the Game of the Decade for the '00s, I CANNOT with a pure conscience recommend it to anyone in the current state of affairs. I'd even go as far as saying that Rockstar has fallen down from one of the best game devs to EA-level.

Despite it being a very good game - Really enjoyed playing it! I have given this review a thumbs down as a flag, as I have included a useful fix for a common launch issue in the game and want anyone experiencing that issue to see this review.   For a while this game ceased to work on my system and many others in the forums shared the same problem, that being that the game freezes in the initial launch phase. Despite knowing it was pretty much a broken game, I decided to try it one last time and as usual the game froze on the black screen. I pressed JUST 'Ctrl + Alt' and was about to hit 'Del' to quit out of the game when the San Andreas credits screen appeared. This had not happened since the game used to originally work fine and would not have happened if I had just loaded the game up and left it for a few minutes to boot up, as before I had left it for about 20 minutes without pressing anything and the game had not progressed any further than the frozen black screen.   Anyway, after I had pressed JUST 'Ctrl + Alt' and saw the credits screen, the game then progressed to the menu screen and I was able to play as normal, with the exception of the main video automatically being skipped where you hear the San Andreas theme and see a few art work shots of a typical in game scene (e.g. a 'drive by and shoot', random in-game characters, etc.), but this really didn't matter to me as I was happy just to have the rest of the game working.  So, if this problem happens to you, launch the game and about 5-10 seconds afterwards press JUST 'Ctrl + Alt', but NOT 'Del' and the San Andreas credits screen should be displayed and then the game should continue to work as usual, of course just without the main video - 'Who cares?'.  Hope this helps anyone with the same issue and happy gaming!

I  thought  it was a fun game to play because i've played it on my PS2 in the early days, so I decided to buy this game on steam because it was on sale. Is it worth your money? Absolutely not! Not even the €2,50 I've spent to buy the game (I'm talking about the steam version right now!). First of all, the game only supports  4:3  screen resolutions for old crappy square computer screens. My laptop has a  1366 x 768  screen resolution and you can't make that choise with only 4 resolutions this version supports. Second of all, I almost spent a whole day googling about it and trying to find a fix. But nothing helpen me out. Later I found about 200 videos on YouTube about a new update '3.0' which is on Steam only. This patch removed 18 probably nice songs from the game, it no longer supports higher resolutions and it removed  EVERYONES  game data. Every single person who made a video about this whas disappointed, even if he/she doesn't like the game. The most videos about this are uploaded about 2 to 3 years ago so I dont think Rockstar Games will  ever  fix this. I've got a refund request pending on this game right now and I'm waitong for Valve to give my money back. This is probably the worst game I've ever bought on steam or on any platform ever.

Despite all the negative reviews this game is getting because of the new update, this game isn't too bad. It still isn't worth buying because you can't change the display resolution of the game, etc. but it isn't as bad as some people are portraying it to be. It's a little of a downgrade because I'm so used to playing GTAIV (graphics aren't as nice, etc.), but it's still a nice game for Sandbox/Open World/GTA fans. I can actually see myself playing this game for hours and hours now, despite all the new update has changed or 'ruined,' as some others may put it.  However, I really hope that Steam releases a new update to fix all of the issues that other players and I have experienced. Initially, I felt that I made a terrible investment. I still kind of feel it's a bad investment in its current state. In its current state, I would give this game a 2.5/5. Once the issues have been resolved, I would definitely give this game a full 5/5.  EDIT: Over 100 hours of gameplay later, I would give this game a full 5/5 hands down! There's a fix for the screen resolution issue (don't remember where I found it or what it is, but you can find it pretty easily on the web. Once the fix is made, this game is great! :D Still like GTAIV a lot better though, even if it requires a lot of fixing up on the Steam Platform.
